meanings.definition: To cast more votes than the number of eligible voters.
meanings.sent1: During the election, some people overvoted by mistake.
meanings.sent2: The candidate was disqualified because they overvoted in the election.
meanings.sent3: It would be funny if a cat accidentally overvoted in a pet election.
meanings.sent4: Her passion for the candidate made her overvote like a river overflowing its banks.
meanings.sent5: The image of overvoting painted a picture of chaos in the voting booth.

meanings.definition: To vote in excess of the number of votes allowed.
meanings.sent1: The student overvoted for their favorite class president candidate.
meanings.sent2: The system rejected his ballot because he overvoted in the school election.
meanings.sent3: It would be strange if a robot overvoted in a robot election.
meanings.sent4: Her enthusiasm caused her to overvote like a cup overflowing with water.
meanings.sent5: The concept of overvoting stood out like a bright light in the voting process.

meanings.definition: To exceed the proper number of votes.
meanings.sent1: The team captain overvoted to ensure their victory in the game.
meanings.sent2: The board of directors nullified the results as someone overvoted in the meeting.
meanings.sent3: It would be amusing if a penguin overvoted in a fish election.
meanings.sent4: Her determination led her to overvote like a balloon expanding beyond its limits.
meanings.sent5: The idea of overvoting was as clear as a bell ringing in the voting hall.
